content.subject: Font Testing and Typography Demonstration - Courier Monospace
body: This letter demonstrates the Courier font family, which provides a monospace typewriter-style appearance. Courier is often used for technical documentation, code listings, and situations where character alignment is critical.
In monospace fonts, every character occupies the same horizontal space. This means that 'i' takes up the same width as 'W'. This property makes Courier excellent for:

While Courier provides excellent character alignment, it may reduce reading speed for long passages of text compared to proportional fonts. The fixed width can create irregular spacing between words and may appear less polished for formal business correspondence.

However, Courier remains an excellent choice for specific use cases where its unique properties provide functional benefits. The consistent character width ensures that formatted text maintains its structure regardless of the viewing or printing environment.

Unlike Times-Roman (serif) or Helvetica (sans-serif), Courier's monospace design prioritizes function over form. While Times-Roman optimizes for readability in long texts and Helvetica provides clean modern appearance, Courier excels in technical precision.

For formal business letters, Times-Roman or Helvetica typically provide better overall appearance for most professional correspondence. This test letter uses Courier to demonstrate its distinctive characteristics and appropriate use cases.

This font test validates that the letter generation system properly handles different font families, including monospace fonts like Courier. The system maintains proper positioning, line spacing, and page breaks regardless of the selected typeface.
content.postscript: P.S. Additional font samples using Times-Roman and Helvetica are available in separate test letters for comprehensive typography validation.
